p: The crop is commercially grown for their nutritional value and they are also used for medicinal purposes ( Waako et al., 2005). The leaves of M. foetida are harvested from the wild and consumed when they are prepared as a vegetable in Gabon, Sudan, Uganda, Tanzania, South Africa and Malawi and some other African countries. The leaves of M. foetida are harvested, boiled and consumed with beans or peas together with a staple food. It is utilized in small amounts as a famine food and in emergency situations.
